title: 1829-A
statement: A. Love Storytime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputTimur loves codeforces. That's why he has a string $$$s$$$ having length $$$10$$$ made containing only lowercase Latin letters. Timur wants to know how many indices string $$$s$$$differsfrom the string "codeforces".For example string $$$s =$$$ "coolforsez" differs from "codeforces" in $$$4$$$ indices, shown in bold.Help Timur by finding the number of indices where string $$$s$$$ differs from "codeforces".Note that you can't reorder the characters in the string $$$s$$$.InputThe first line contains a single integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \\leq t \\leq 1000$$$) — the number of test cases.Each test case is one line and contains the string $$$s$$$, consisting of exactly $$$10$$$ lowercase Latin characters.OutputFor each test case, output a single integer — the number of indices where string $$$s$$$ differs.ExampleInput5coolforsezcadafurciecodeforcespaiuforcesforcescodeOutput4 5 0 4 9

processed.result:
You are given a string of length 10 consisting of lowercase letters.  Determine the number of positions where the string differs from the string "codeforces". 

Input:

* The first line contains an integer  $t$ ($1 \leq t \leq 1000$) representing the number of test cases.
* Each of the following lines contains a string of length 10 consisting of lowercase letters.

Output:

* For each test case, output a single integer representing the number of positions where the input string differs from "codeforces".
You are given a 10-letter word.  Count how many letters in the word are different from the word "codeforces".
